Lines.Description: If 'camera_x' LessThan 'Player_X / XRes * XRes' ELSE GOTO 00000758
If 'camera_x' GreaterThan 'Player_X / XRes * XRes' ELSE GOTO 00000842
If 'camera_y' LessThan 'Player_y / yres * yres' ELSE GOTO 00000926
If 'camera_y' GreaterThan 'Player_y / yres * yres' ELSE GOTO 00001010
Say 'Judge: Well, that simplifies matters. Who is your witness?'
Say 'Payne: The man who found the victim's body.'
Say 'Payne: Just before making the gruesome discovery...'
Say 'Payne: He saw the defendant fleeing the scene of the crime!'
Say 'Judge: Order! Order in the court!'
Say 'Judge: Mr. Payne, the prosecution may call its witness.'
Say 'Payne: On the day of the murder, my witness was selling newspapers at the victim's building.'
Say 'Payne: Please bring Mr. Frank Sahwit to the stand!'
Say 'Payne: Mr. Sahwit, you sell newspaper subscriptions, is this correct?'
Say 'Sahwit: Oh, oh yes! Newspapers, yes!'
Say 'Judge: Mr. Sahwit, you may proceed with your testimony.'
Say 'Judge: Please tell the court what you saw on the day of the murder.'
Say 'Sahwit: I was going door-to-door, selling subscriptions when I saw a man fleeing an apartment.'
Say 'Sahwit: I thought he must be in a hurry because he left the door half-open behind him.'
Say 'Sahwit: Thinking it strange, I looked inside the apartment.'
Say 'Sahwit: Then I saw her lying there... A woman... not moving... dead!'
Say 'Sahwit: I quailed in fright and found myself unable to go inside.'
Say 'Sahwit: I thought to call the police immediately!'
Say 'Sahwit: However, the phone in her apartment wasn't working.'
Say 'Sahwit: I went to a nearby park and found a public phone.'
Say 'Sahwit: I remember the time exactly: It was 1:00pm.'
Say 'Sahwit: The man who ran was, without a doubt, the defantant sitting right over there.'
Say 'Phoenix: (Larry! Why didn't you tell the truth?)'
Say 'Phoenix: (I can't defend you against a testimony like that!)'
Say 'Judge: Incidentally, why wasn't the phone in the victim's apartment working?'
Say 'Payne: Your Honor, at the time of the murder, there was a blackout in the building.'
Say 'Judge: Aren't phones supposed to work during a blackout?'
Say 'Payne: However, some cordless phones do not function normally.'
Say 'Payne: The phone that Mr. Sahwit used was one of those.'
Say 'Payne: I have a record of the blackout, for your perusal.'
Say 'Blackout Record added to the Court Record.'
Say 'Phoenix: Yes! Er... yes, Your Honor?'
Say 'Judge: You may begin your cross-examination.'
Say 'Mia: Alright, Wright, this is it. The real deal!'
Say 'Phoenix: Uh... what exactly am I supposed to do?'
Say 'Mia: Why, you expose the lies in the testimony the witness just gave!'
Say 'Phoenix: Lies! What?! He was lying!?'
Say 'Mia: Your client is innocent, right?'
Say 'Mia: Then that witness must have lied in his testimony!'
Say 'Mia: Or is your client really... guilty?'
Say 'Phoenix: !!! How do I prove he's not?'
Say 'Mia: You hold the key. It's in the evidence!'
Say 'Mia: Compare the witness's testimony to the evidence at hand.'
Say 'Mia: There's bound to be a contradiction in there!'
Say 'Mia: First, find contradictions between the Court Record and the witness's testimony.'
Say 'Mia: Then, once you've found the contradicting evidence...'
Say 'Mia: Present it and rub it in the witness's face!'
Say 'Mia: Look at the Court Record and point out the contradictions in the testimony!'
Say 'Judge: She died because she was...?'
Say 'Phoenix: Oh, right! Wasn't she, um, poisioned by er... poison?'
Say 'Phoenix: Um... Chief! Help me out!'
Say 'Mia: Check the court record. Remember?'
Say 'Phoenix: (Geez. Give a guy a break!)'
Say 'Phoenix: Right... she was strangled, wasn't she?'
Say 'Mia: Please tell me that was you talking to yourself.'
Say 'Judge: If you wish to hang yourself Mr. Wright, you're welcome to, but not inside my courtroom.'
Say 'Judge: I suppose there's nothing to do but give you another try:'
Say 'Phoenix: She was struck once, by a blunt object.'
Say 'Judge: You've answered all my questions. I see no reason why we shouldn't proceed.'
Say 'Judge: You seem much more relaxed, Mr. Wright. Good for you.'
Say 'Thank you (Because I don't FEEL relaxed)'
Say 'Judge: Please state the name of the defendant in this case.'
Say 'Judge: Sorry, I couldn't hear your answer. I'll ask once more:'
Say 'Phoenix: Um... the defendant... is me, right?'
Say 'Mia: Wright! Have you completely lost your mind? Focus!'
Say 'Mia: The defendant is the person on trial!'
Say 'Phoenix: Um, er, eh? Oh yeah, right! Eh heh heh.'
Say 'Mia: This is no laughing matter!'
Say 'Mia: You did pass the bar, didn't you?'
Say 'Phoenix: The, um, defendant? That's... er... Mia Fey?'
Say 'Mia: Wrong, Wright. Look, I have to leave.'
Say 'Mia: I have to go home. I'm... I'm expecting a delivery.'
Say 'Phoenix: Aw, c'mon Chief. There's no need to be going so soon, is there?'
Say 'Mia: Listen: the defendant is the one on trial--your client!'
Say 'Mia: I mean, that's about as basic as you can get!'
Say 'Phoenix: (I put my foot in it this time! I've got to relax!)'
Say 'Phoenix: The defendant? Well, that's Larry Butz, Your Honor.'
Say 'Judge: Just keep your wits about you and you'll do fine.'
Say 'Judge: This is a murder trial. Tell me - '
Say 'Phoenix: (Whew, I know this one! Glad I read the case report cover to cover so many times.)'
Say 'Phoenix: (No... no way! I forgot! I'm drawing a total blank here!)'
Say 'Mia: Phoenix! Are you absolutely SURE you're up to this?'
Say 'Mia: You don't even know the victim's name!?'
Say 'Phoenix: Oh, the victim! O-Of course I know the victim's name!'
Say 'Phoenix: I, um, just forgot. ... Temporarily'
Say 'Mia: I think I feel a migraine coming on.'
Say 'Mia: Look, the victim's name is listed in the Court Record.'
Say 'Mia: Just select Court Record to check it, okay?'
Say 'Mia: Remember to check it often. Do it for me, please. I'm begging you.'
Say 'Judge: Let's hear your answer. Who is the victim in this case.'
Say 'Mia: W-W-What!? How can I be the victim!?'
Say 'Phoenix: Oh! Right! Sorry! I, er, it was the first name that popped into my head, and--'
Say 'Mia: The Court Record! Remember to use it when you are in a pinch.'
Say 'Judge: Let me ask that one again:'
Say 'Phoenix: Oh, um, wasn't it Ms. Block? Ms. Cinder Block?'
Say 'Judge: The person in question was a victim of murder, not ill- conceived naming, Mr. Wright.'
Say 'Mia: If you forget something, just use the Court Record to help you remember.'
Say 'Mia: A mistake in court could cost you the case.'
Say 'Phoenix: Um... the victim's name is Cindy Stone.'
Say 'Judge: Now, tell me, what was the cause of death?'
Say 'Sahwit: I was going door-to-door, selling subscriptions when I saw a man fleeing an apartment.'
Say 'Sahwit: I thought he must be in a hurry because he left the door half-open behind him.'
Say 'Sahwit: Thinking it strange, I looked inside the apartment.'
Say 'Sahwit: Then I saw her lying there... A woman... not moving... dead!'
Say 'Sahwit: I quailed in fright and found myself unable to go inside.'
Say 'Sahwit: I thought to call the police immediately!'
Say 'Sahwit: However, the phone in her apartment wasn't working.'
Say 'Sahwit: I went to a nearby park and found a public phone.'
Say 'Sahwit: I remember the time exactly: It was 1:00PM.'
Say 'Sahwit: The man who ran was, without a doubt, the defendant sitting right over there.'
Say 'Mia: There must be a contradiction in there somewhere.'
Say 'Mia: Examine the Court Record if something strikes you as being suspicious.'
Say 'Mia: Then, find the evidence that contradicts his testimony, and present it to him!'
Say 'Phoenix: You found the body at 1:00 PM. You're sure?'
Say 'Sahwit: Yes. It was 1:00 PM, for certain.'
Say 'Phoenix: Frankly, I find that hard to believe!'
Say 'Phoenix: Your statement directly contradicts the autopsy report.'
Say 'Phoenix: The autopsy notes the time of death at sometime after 4PM.'
Say 'Phoenix: There was no body to... er... no "body" to find at 1:00 PM!'
Say 'Phoenix: How do you explain this three-hour gap?'
Say 'Payne: This is trivial! The witness merely forgot the time!'
Say 'Judge: After his testimony, I find that hard to believe.'
Say 'Judge: Why were you so certain that you found the body at 1:00pm?'
Say 'Sahwit: I... er... well, I... Gee, that's a really good question!'
Say 'Mia: Great job, Wright! Way to put him on the spot!'
Say 'Mia: That's all you have to do: point out contradictions!'
Say 'Mia: Lies always beget more lies!'
Say 'Mia: See through one, and their whole story falls apart!'
Say 'Phoenix: Your Honor! What do you think about the witness's statement?'
Say 'Judge: Uh... I'm not sure I follow?'
Say 'Phoenix: It clearly, er, contradicts the... um... I thought...'
Say 'Judge: You don't sound very convinced, Mr. Wright.'
Say 'Phoenix: (I don't think that won me any points with the judge...)'
Say 'Judge: First, a question for the prosecution. Mr. Payne?'
Say 'Judge: As Mr. Wright just told us, the victim was struck with a blunt object.'
Say 'Judge: Would you explain to the court just what that "object" was?'
Say 'Payne: The murder weapon was this statue of "The Thinker."'
Say 'Payne: It was found lying on the floor, next to the victim.'
Say 'Judge: I see... the court accepts it into evidence.'
Say 'Statue added to the court record.'
Say 'Mia: Be sure to pay attention to any evidence added during the trial.'
Say 'Mia: That evidence is the only ammunition you have in court.'
Say 'Mia: Check the Court record frequently.'
Say 'Judge: Mr. Payne, the prosecution may call its first witness.'
Say 'Payne: The prosecution calls the defendant, Mr. Butz, to the stand.'
Say 'Phoenix: Um, Chief, what do I do now?'
Say 'Mia: Pay attention. You don't want to miss any information that might help your client's case.'
Say 'Mia: You'll get your chance to respond to the prosecution later, so be ready!'
Say 'Mia: Let's just hope he doesn't say anything... unfortunate.'
Say 'Phoenix: (Uh oh, Larry gets excited easily... this could be bad.)'
Say 'Payne: Mr. Butz. Is it not true that the victim had recently dumped you?'
Say 'Butz: We were great together! We were Romeo and Juliet, Cleopatra and Mark Anthony!'
Say 'Butz: I wasn't dumped! She just wasn't taking my phone call. Or seeing me... Ever.'
Say 'Butz: WHAT'S IT TO YOU, ANYWAY!?'
Say 'Payne: Mr. Butz, what you describe is generally what we mean by "dumped."'
Say 'Payne: In fact, she had completely abandoned you... and was seeing other men!'
Say 'Payne: She had just returned from overseas with one of them the day before the murder!'
Say 'Butz: Lies! All of it, lies! I don't believe a word of it.'
Say 'Payne: Your Honor, the victim's passport.'
Say 'Payne: According to this, she was in Paris until the day before she died.'
Say 'Passport added to the court record.'
Say 'Judge: Hmm... Indeed, she appears to have returned the day before the murder.'
Say 'Payne: The victim was a model, but did not have a large income.'
Say 'Payne: It appears that she has several "Sugar Daddies."'
Say 'Payne: Yes. Older men, who gave her money and gifts.'
Say 'Payne: She took their money and used it to support their lifestyle.'
Say 'Payne: We can clearly see what kind of woman this Ms. Stone was.'
Say 'Payne: Tell me, Mr. Butz, what do you think of her now?'
Say 'Mia: I don't think you want him to answer than question.'
Say 'Phoenix: (Yeah... Larry has a way of running his mouth in all the wrong directions.)'
Say 'Phoenix: (Might be better not to get involved in this one...)'
Say 'Butz: Dude, no way! That cheatin' she-dog!'
Say 'Phoenix: My client had no idea the victim was seeing other men!'
Say 'Phoenix: That question is irrelevant to this case!'
Say 'Butz: I'm gonna die. I'm just gonna drop dead!'
Say 'Butz: And when I meet her in the afterlife...'
Say 'Butz: I'm going to get to the bottom of this!'
Say 'Judge: Let's continue with the trial, shall we?'
Say 'Payne: I believe the accused's motive is clear to everyone.'
Say 'Phoenix: (Oh boy. This is so not looking good.)'
Say 'Payne: You went to the victim's apartment on the day of the murder, did you not?'
Say 'Payne: Well, did you, or did you not?'
Say 'Butz: Heh? Heh heh. Well, maybe I did, and maybe I didn't!'
Say 'Phoenix: (I know! I'll send him a signal...)'
Say 'Butz: Er... Yeah! Yeah! I was there! I went!'
Say 'Butz: She wasn't home, man... So, like, I didn't see her.'
Say 'Payne: Your Honor, the defendant is lying.'
Say 'Payne: The prosectution would like to call a witness who can prove Mr. Butz is lying.'
Say 'Phoenix: (I know! I'll send him a signal...)'
Say 'Butz: Um, well, see it's like this: I don't remember.'
Say 'Payne: Well then, we'll just have to remind you!'
Say 'Phoenix: (I've got a bad feeling about this...)'
Say 'Payne: We have a witness that can prove he DID go to the victim's apartment that day!'

Say 'Attorney's Badge:
No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.'

Say 'Cindy's Autopsy Report:
Time of Death: 7-31, 4PM-5PM. Cause of death: loss of blood due to blunt trauma.'

Say 'Statue/The Thinker:
A statue in the shape of "The Thinker". It's rather heavy.'

Say 'Passport:
The victim apparently arrived home from Paris on 7/30, the day before the murder.'

Say 'Blackout Record:
Electricity to Ms. Stone's building was out from noon to 6 PM on the day of the crime.'

Say 'Mia Fey. Age 27. Female:
Chief Attorney at Fey and Co My boss, and a very good defense attorney.'

Say 'Larry Butz. Age 23. Male:
The defendant in this case. A likeable guy who was my friend in grade school.'

Say 'Cindy Stone. Age 22. Female:
The victim in this case. A model, she lived in an apartment by herself.'

Say 'Winston Paine. Age 52. Male:
The prosecutor for this case. Lacks presence, Generally bad at getting his points across.'
Say 'I can't get caught... Not like this!'
Say 'I-I've gotta find someone to pin this on...'
Say 'I'll make it look like... HE did it!'
Say 'Judge: The court is now in session for the trial of Mr. Larry Butz.'
Say 'Payne: The prosecution is ready, Your Honor.'
Say 'Phoenix: The, um, defense is ready, Your Honor.'
Say 'Judge: This is your first trial, is it not?'
Say 'Phoenix: Y-Yes, Your Honor. I'm, um, a little nervous.'
Say 'Judge: Your contact during this trial will decide the fate of your client.'
Say 'Judge: Murder is a serious charge. For your client's sake, I hope you can control your nerves.'
Say 'Phoenix: Thank... thank you, Your Honor.'
Say 'Judge: Mr. Wright, given the circumstances...'
Say 'Judge: I think we should have a test to ascertain your readiness.'
Say 'Judge: The test will consist of a few simple questions. Answer them clearly and concisely.'

Say 'August 3, 9:47 AM
District Court Defendant Lobby No. 2'
Say 'Mia: Whew, I'm glad I made it on time.'
Say 'Mia: Well, I have to say Phoenix, I'm impressed!'
Say 'Mia: Not everyone takes on a murder trial right off the bat like this.'
Say 'Mia: It says a lot about you... and your client as well.'
Say 'Phoenix: Actually, it's because I owe him a favor.'
Say 'Mia: You mean, you knew the defendant before this case?'
Say 'Phoenix: Actually, I kind of owe my current job to him.'
Say 'Phoenix: He's one of the reasons I became an attorney.'
Say 'Mia: Well, that's news to me!'
Say 'Phoenix: I want to help him out any way I can!'
Say 'Phoenix: I just... really want to help him. I owe him that much.'
Say '???: (My life, everything, it's all over!)'
Say 'Mia: Isn't that your client screaming over there?'
Say '???: (I'm gonna do it, I'm gonna die!!!)'
Say 'Mia: It sounds like he wants to die...'
Say 'Butz: Dude, I'm so guilty!! Tell them I'm guilty!!!'
Say 'Butz: Gimmie the death sentence! I ain't afraid to die!'
Say 'Butz: oh, it's all over... I... I'm finished. Finished!'
Say 'Butz: I can't live in a world without her! I can't!'
Say 'Butz: Who... who took her away from me, Nick? Who did this?'
Say 'Butz: Aww, Nick, ya gotta tell me! Who took my baby away!?'
Say 'Phoenix: (The newspapers say it was you...)'
Say 'Phoenix: My name is Phoenix Wright.'
Say 'Phoenix: My first case is a fairly simple one.'
Say 'Phoenix: A young woman was killed in her apartment.'
Say 'Phoenix: The guy they arrested was the unlucky sap dating her:'
Say 'Phoenix: Larry Butz... my best friend since grade school.'
Say 'Phoenix: Our school had a saying: "When something smells, it's usually the Butz."'
Say 'Phoenix: In the 23 years I've known him, it's usually been true.'
Say 'Phoenix: He has a knack for getting himself in trouble.'
Say 'Phoenix: One thing I can say though: it's usually not his fault. He just has terrible luck.'
Say 'Phoenix: But I know better than anyone that he's a good guy a heart.'
Say 'Phoenix: That and I owe him one. Which is why I took the case... to clear his name.'
Say 'Phoenix: And that's just what I'm going to do!'
